intro: Boscia welwitschii, commonly known as the welwitschiak, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its thick, woody stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by small, round, orange fruits that are edible. It is well adapted to arid environments and can survive in poor soil conditions. Boscia welwitschii is also known for its ability to store water in its stems, making it a resilient species in dry regions.
